title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 1. These Rules may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Pilot Transfer
text_raw:
1. These Rules may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Pilot Transfer 

Arrangements) Rules 2020. 

Definitions

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: In these Rules–
text_raw:
2. 

In these Rules– 

“installed on or after 1 July 2012” in relation to a ship, means- 

(a) 

(b) 

for a ship for which a building contract is placed on or after 1 
July 2012, or in the absence of the contract, constructed on or 
after 1 July 2012, any installation on the ship, and 

for a ship, other than those ships referred to in paragraph (a), a 
contractual delivery date for the system, in its entirety or for 
individual components of the system, as relevant, to the ship on 
or after 1 July 2012 or, in the absence of a contractual delivery 
date, the actual delivery of the system, in its entirety or for 
individual components, to the ship on or after 1 July 2012. This 
does not apply to equipment and arrangements to which Rule 5 
(5) applies; 

“MSO” means the Marine Survey Office of the Department of Transport; 

“pilot” means any person not belonging to a ship who has the conduct of the 
ship; 

“Resolution A.889 (21)” means the Recommendation on Pilot Transfer 
Arrangements adopted by Resolution A.889 (21) on 25 November 1999 of the 
International Maritime Organisation; 

“Resolution A.1108 (29)” means the Recommendation on Pilot Transfer 
Arrangements adopted by Resolution A.1045 (27) on 30 November 2011, as 
amended by Resolution A.1108 (29) adopted on 2 December 2015, of the 
International Maritime Organisation. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 5th January, 2021.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 3. The purpose of these Rules is to implement Regulation 23 of Chapter V
text_raw:
3. The purpose of these Rules is to implement Regulation 23 of Chapter V 
of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea (SOLAS) 1974 
regarding pilot transfer arrangements and to ensure that pilot ladders and their 
arrangements, use and maintenance conform to standards set out for equipment 
and arrangements for pilot transfer which– 

(a) were installed on a ship on or after 1 January 1994 but before 1 
July 2012, set out in the Annex to Resolution A.889 (21), or 

(b) 

are installed on a ship on or after 1 July 2012, set out in the 
Annex to Resolution A.1108 (29). 

Application
text_norm: 3 purpose rule implement regulation 23 chapter v international convention safety life sea (solas) 1974 regarding pilot transfer arrangement ensure pilot ladder arrangement use maintenance conform standard set equipment arrangement pilot transfer which- (a) installed ship 1 january 1994 1 july 2012 set annex resolution a.889 (21) (b) installed ship 1 july 2012 set annex resolution a.1108 (29) application

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 4. These Rules do not apply to fishing vessels.
text_raw:
4. These Rules do not apply to fishing vessels. 

Pilot transfer arrangements
text_norm: 4 rule apply fishing vessel pilot transfer arrangement

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 5. (1) Ships engaged on voyages in the course of which pilots are likely to
text_raw:
5. (1) Ships engaged on voyages in the course of which pilots are likely to 

be employed shall be provided with pilot transfer arrangements. 

(2) Equipment and arrangements for pilot transfer which were installed on 
a ship on or after 1 January 1994 but before 1 July 2012 shall comply with the 
requirements of these Rules and conform to standards set out in Schedule 1 
(being the standards set out in the Annex to Resolution A.889 (21)). 

(3) Equipment and arrangements for pilot transfer which are installed on a 

ship on or after 1 July 2012, shall- 

(a) 

comply with the requirements of these Rules and conform to 
standards set out in Schedule 2 (being the standards set out in 
the Annex to Resolution A.1108 (29)), and 

(b) 

in the case of a pilot ladder– 

(i) 

be certified by the manufacturer as complying with section 
2 of Schedule 2 or an international standard specified for 
the time being by the MSO, and 

(ii) be clearly identified with tags or other permanent marking 
so as to enable identification of each appliance for the 
purposes of survey, inspection and record keeping. 

(4) A record shall be kept on a ship as to the date a ladder identified under 

paragraph (3)(b)(ii) is placed into service and any repairs effected. 

(5) Reference in these Rules to an accommodation ladder includes a 

sloping ladder used as part of the pilot transfer arrangements. 

(6) Equipment and arrangements, installed on a ship on or after 1 July 
2012, which are a replacement of equipment and arrangements provided on a 
ship before 1 July 2012, shall, in so far as is reasonable and practicable, 
comply with paragraph (4). 

 
 
 
 
 4 [686] 

Pilot transfer - safety
text_norm: 5 (1) ship engaged voyage course pilot likely employed shall provided pilot transfer arrangement (2) equipment arrangement pilot transfer installed ship 1 january 1994 1 july 2012 shall comply requirement rule conform standard set schedule 1 (being standard set annex resolution a.889 (21)) (3) equipment arrangement pilot transfer installed ship 1 july 2012 shall- (a) comply requirement rule conform standard set schedule 2 (being standard set annex resolution a.1108 (29)) (b) case pilot ladder- (i) certified manufacturer complying section 2 schedule 2 international standard specified time mso (ii) clearly identified tag permanent marking enable identification appliance purpose survey inspection record keeping (4) record shall kept ship date ladder identified paragraph (3)(b)(ii) placed service repair effected (5) reference rule accommodation ladder includes sloping ladder used part pilot transfer arrangement (6) equipment arrangement installed ship 1 july 2012 replacement equipment arrangement provided ship 1 july 2012 shall far reasonable practicable comply paragraph (4) 4 686 pilot transfer - safety

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 6. (1) All arrangements used for pilot transfer shall efficiently fulfil their
text_raw:
6. (1) All arrangements used for pilot transfer shall efficiently fulfil their 
purpose of enabling pilots to embark and disembark safely. The appliances 
shall be kept clean, properly maintained and stowed and shall be regularly 
inspected to ensure that they are safe to use. They shall be used solely for the 
embarkation and disembarkation of personnel. 

(2) The rigging of the pilot transfer arrangements and the embarkation and 
disembarkation of a pilot shall be supervised by a responsible officer having 
means of communication with the navigation bridge and who shall also arrange 
for the escort of the pilot by a safe route to and from the navigation bridge. 
Personnel engaged in rigging and operating any mechanical equipment shall be 
instructed in the safe procedures to be adopted and the equipment shall be 
tested prior to use. 

Pilot transfer – ship embarkation and disembarkation arrangements
text_norm: 6 (1) arrangement used pilot transfer shall efficiently fulfil purpose enabling pilot embark disembark safely appliance shall kept clean properly maintained stowed shall regularly inspected ensure safe use shall used solely embarkation disembarkation personnel (2) rigging pilot transfer arrangement embarkation disembarkation pilot shall supervised responsible officer mean communication navigation bridge shall also arrange escort pilot safe route navigation bridge personnel engaged rigging operating mechanical equipment shall instructed safe procedure adopted equipment shall tested prior use pilot transfer - ship embarkation disembarkation arrangement

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7. (1) Arrangements shall be provided to enable the pilot to embark and
text_raw:
7. (1) Arrangements shall be provided to enable the pilot to embark and 

disembark safely on either side of the ship. 

(2) In all ships where the distance from sea level to the point of access to, 
or egress from, the ship exceeds 9 metres, and when it is intended to embark 
and disembark pilots by means of the accommodation ladder or other equally 
safe and convenient means in conjunction with a pilot ladder, the ship shall 
carry such equipment on each side, unless the equipment is capable of being 
transferred for use on either side. 

(3) Safe and convenient access to, and egress from, the ship shall be 

provided by either: 

(a) 

a pilot ladder requiring a climb of not less than 1.5 metres and 
not more than 9 metres above the surface of the water so 
positioned and secured that- 

(i) 

(ii) 

it is clear of any possible discharges from the ship, 

it is within the parallel body length of the ship and, as far 
as is practicable, within the mid-ship half length of the 
ship, 

(iii) each step rests firmly against the ship's side; where 
constructional features, such as rubbing bands, would 
prevent the implementation of this provision, special 
arrangements shall, to the satisfaction of the MSO be 
made to ensure that persons are able to embark and 
disembark safely, and 

(iv) 

the single length of pilot ladder is capable of reaching the 
water from the point of access to, or egress from, the ship 
and due allowance is made for all conditions of loading 
and trim of the ship, and for an adverse list of 15 degrees; 
the securing strongpoints, shackles and securing ropes 
shall be at least as strong as the side ropes; or 

 
 
 [686] 5 

(b) 

an accommodation ladder in conjunction with the pilot ladder 
(i.e. a combination arrangement) or other equally safe and 
convenient means, whenever the distance from the surface of the 
water to the point of access to the ship is more than 9 metres. 
The accommodation ladder shall be sited leading aft. When in 
use, means shall be provided to secure the lower platform of the 
accommodation ladder to the ship’s side, so as to ensure that the 
lower end of the accommodation ladder and the lower platform 
are held firmly against the ship's side within the parallel body 
length of the ship and, as far as is practicable, within the midship half length and clear of all discharges. 

(4) When a combination arrangement is used for pilot access, means shall 
be provided to secure the pilot ladder and man-ropes to the ship’s side at a 
point of nominally 1.5 metres above 
the 
accommodation ladder. In the case of a combination arrangement using an 
accommodation ladder with a trapdoor in the bottom platform (i.e. embarkation 
platform), the pilot ladder and man-ropes shall be rigged through the trapdoor 
extending above the platform to the height of the handrail. 

the bottom platform of 

Access to ship's deck

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 8. (1) Means shall be provided to ensure safe, convenient and unobstructed
text_raw:
8. (1) Means shall be provided to ensure safe, convenient and unobstructed 
passage for any person embarking on, or disembarking from, the ship between 
the head of the pilot ladder, or of any accommodation ladder or other 
appliance, and the ship's deck. 

(2) Where the aforesaid passage is by means of a gateway in the rails or 

bulwark, adequate handholds shall be provided. 

(3) Where the aforesaid passage is by means of a bulwark ladder, two 
handhold stanchions rigidly secured to the ship's structure at or near their bases 
and at higher points shall be fitted. The bulwark ladder shall be securely 
attached to the ship to prevent overturning. 

Shipside doors
text_norm: 8 (1) mean shall provided ensure safe convenient unobstructed passage person embarking disembarking ship head pilot ladder accommodation ladder appliance ship deck (2) aforesaid passage mean gateway rail bulwark adequate handhold shall provided (3) aforesaid passage mean bulwark ladder two handhold stanchion rigidly secured ship structure near base higher point shall fitted bulwark ladder shall securely attached ship prevent overturning shipside door

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 11. (1) The following associated equipment shall be kept at hand ready for
text_raw:
11. (1) The following associated equipment shall be kept at hand ready for 

immediate use when persons are being transferred: 

(a) 

two man-ropes of not less than 28 millimetres and not more than 
32 millimetres in diameter properly secured to the ship if 
required by the pilot; man-ropes shall be fixed at the rope end to 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [686] 

the ring plate fixed on deck and shall be ready for use when the 
pilot disembarks, or upon request from a pilot approaching to 
board (the man-ropes shall reach the height of the stanchions or 
bulwarks at the point of access to the deck before terminating at 
the ring plate on deck); 

(b) 

a lifebuoy equipped with a self-igniting light; and 

(c) 

a heaving line. 

(2) When required by Rule 8, stanchions and bulwark ladders shall be 

provided. 

Lighting

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.1.3 No pilot ladder should have more than two replacement steps which are
text_raw:
2.1.3 No pilot ladder should have more than two replacement steps which are 
secured in position by a method different from that used in the original 
construction of the ladder, and any steps so secured should be replaced as soon 
as reasonably practicable by steps secured in position by the method used in 
the original construction of the pilot ladder. When any replacement step is 
secured to the side ropes of the pilot ladder by means of grooves in the sides of 
the step, such grooves should be in the longer sides of the step.
text_norm: 2.1.3 pilot ladder two replacement step secured position method different used original construction ladder step secured replaced soon reasonably practicable step secured position method used original construction pilot ladder replacement step secured side rope pilot ladder mean groove side step groove longer side step

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.1.4 Pilot ladders with more than five steps should have spreader steps not
text_raw:
2.1.4 Pilot ladders with more than five steps should have spreader steps not 
less than 1.8 metres long provided at such intervals as will prevent the pilot 
ladder from twisting. The lowest spreader step should be the fifth step from the 

 
 
 8 [686] 

bottom of the ladder and the interval between any spreader step and the next 
should not exceed nine steps.
text_norm: 2.1.4 pilot ladder five step spreader step le 1.8 metre long provided interval prevent pilot ladder twisting lowest spreader step fifth step 8 686 bottom ladder interval spreader step next exceed nine step

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 4. MECHANICAL PILOT HOISTS

The use of mechanical pilot hoists is prohibited.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 5. ACCESS TO DECK
text_raw:
5. ACCESS TO DECK 

Means should be provided to ensure safe, convenient and unobstructed passage 
for any person embarking on, or disembarking from, the ship between the head 
of the pilot ladder, or of any accommodation ladder, and the ship's deck; such 
access should be gained directly by a platform securely guarded by handrails. 
Where such passage is by means of:
text_norm: 5 access deck mean provided ensure safe convenient unobstructed passage person embarking disembarking ship head pilot ladder accommodation ladder ship deck access gained directly platform securely guarded handrail passage mean

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 1. a gateway in the rails or bulwark, adequate handholds should be
text_raw:
1. a gateway in the rails or bulwark, adequate handholds should be 

provided.
text_norm: 1 gateway rail bulwark adequate handhold provided

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2. a bulwark ladder should be securely attached to the ship to prevent
text_raw:
2. a bulwark ladder should be securely attached to the ship to prevent 
overturning. Two handhold stanchions should be fitted at the point 
of embarking on or disembarking from the ship on each side which 
should be not less than 0.7 metres or more than 0.8 metres apart. 
Each stanchion should be rigidly secured to the ship's structure at or 
near its base and also at a higher point, should be not less than 32 
millimetres in diameter and should extend not less than 1.2 metres 
above the top of the bulwarks. Stanchions or handrails should not be 
attached to the bulwark ladder. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 [686] 

Regulation 5(3)
text_norm: 2 bulwark ladder securely attached ship prevent overturning two handhold stanchion fitted point embarking disembarking ship side le 0.7 metre 0.8 metre apart stanchion rigidly secured ship structure near base also higher point le 32 millimetre diameter extend le 1.2 metre top bulwark stanchion handrail attached bulwark ladder 10 686 regulation 5(3)

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.1.3 No pilot ladder should have more than two replacement steps which are
text_raw:
2.1.3 No pilot ladder should have more than two replacement steps which are 
secured in position by a method different from that used in the original 
construction of the ladder, and any steps so secured should be replaced as soon 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [686] 11 

as reasonably practicable by steps secured in position by the method used in 
the original construction of the pilot ladder. When any replacement step is 
secured to the side ropes of the pilot ladder by means of grooves in the sides of 
the step, such grooves should be in the longer sides of the step.
text_norm: 2.1.3 pilot ladder two replacement step secured position method different used original construction ladder step secured replaced soon 686 11 reasonably practicable step secured position method used original construction pilot ladder replacement step secured side rope pilot ladder mean groove side step groove longer side step

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.1.4 Pilot ladders with more than five steps should have spreader steps not
text_raw:
2.1.4 Pilot ladders with more than five steps should have spreader steps not 
less than 1.8 metres long provided at such intervals as will prevent the pilot 
ladder from twisting. The lowest spreader step should be the fifth step from the 
bottom of the ladder and the interval between any spreader step and the next 
should not exceed nine steps.
text_norm: 2.1.4 pilot ladder five step spreader step le 1.8 metre long provided interval prevent pilot ladder twisting lowest spreader step fifth step bottom ladder interval spreader step next exceed nine step

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.1.5 When a retrieval line is considered necessary to ensure the safe rigging
text_raw:
2.1.5 When a retrieval line is considered necessary to ensure the safe rigging 
of a pilot ladder, the line should be fastened at or above the last spreader step 
and should lead forward. The retrieval line should not hinder the pilot nor 
obstruct the safe approach of the pilot boat.
text_norm: 2.1.5 retrieval line considered necessary ensure safe rigging pilot ladder line fastened last spreader step lead forward retrieval line hinder pilot obstruct safe approach pilot boat

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.1.6 A permanent marking should be provided at regular intervals (e.g. 1
text_raw:
2.1.6 A permanent marking should be provided at regular intervals (e.g. 1 
metre) throughout the length of the ladder consistent with ladder design, use 
and maintenance in order to facilitate the rigging of the ladder to the required 
height.
text_norm: 2.1.6 permanent marking provided regular interval (e.g 1 metre) throughout length ladder consistent ladder design use maintenance order facilitate rigging ladder required height

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.2 Ropes
text_raw: 2.2 Ropes
text_norm: 2.2 rope

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.2.1 The side ropes of the pilot ladder should consist of two uncovered ropes
text_raw:
2.2.1 The side ropes of the pilot ladder should consist of two uncovered ropes 
not less than 18 millimetres in diameter on each side and should be continuous, 
with no joints and have a breaking strength of at least 24 Kilo Newtons per side 
rope. The two side ropes should each consist of one continuous length of rope, 
the midpoint half-length being located on a thimble large enough to 
accommodate at least two passes of side rope.
text_norm: 2.2.1 side rope pilot ladder consist two uncovered rope le 18 millimetre diameter side continuous joint breaking strength least 24 kilo newton per side rope two side rope consist one continuous length rope midpoint half-length located thimble large enough accommodate least two pass side rope

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.2.2 Side ropes should be made of manila or other material of equivalent
text_raw:
2.2.2 Side ropes should be made of manila or other material of equivalent 
strength, durability, elongation characteristics and grip which has been 
protected against actinic degradation and is satisfactory to the MSO.
text_norm: 2.2.2 side rope made manila material equivalent strength durability elongation characteristic grip protected actinic degradation satisfactory mso

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2.2.3 Each pair of side ropes should be secured together both above and
text_raw:
2.2.3 Each pair of side ropes should be secured together both above and 
below each step with a mechanical clamping device properly designed for this 
purpose, or seizing method with step fixtures (chocks or widgets), which holds 
each step level when the ladder is hanging freely. The preferred method is 
seizing.
text_norm: 2.2.3 pair side rope secured together step mechanical clamping device properly designed purpose seizing method step fixture (chocks widgets) hold step level ladder hanging freely preferred method seizing

may be accepted, provided that they are equally safe.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: The length of the accommodation ladder should be sufficient to ensure
text_raw:
3.2 
The length of the accommodation ladder should be sufficient to ensure 
that its angle of slope does not exceed 45 degrees. In ships with large draft 
ranges, several pilot ladder hanging positions may be provided, resulting in 
lesser angles of slope. The accommodation ladder should be at least 600 
millimetres in width.
text_norm: 3.2 length accommodation ladder sufficient ensure angle slope exceed 45 degree ship large draft range several pilot ladder hanging position may provided resulting lesser angle slope accommodation ladder least 600 millimetre width

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: The lower platform of the accommodation ladder should be in a
text_raw:
3.3 
The lower platform of the accommodation ladder should be in a 
horizontal position and secured to the ship's side when in use. The lower 
platform should be a minimum of 5 metres above sea level.
text_norm: 3.3 lower platform accommodation ladder horizontal position secured ship side use lower platform minimum 5 metre sea level

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: Intermediate platforms, if fitted, should be self-levelling. Treads and
text_raw:
3.4 
Intermediate platforms, if fitted, should be self-levelling. Treads and 
steps of the accommodation ladder should be so designed that an adequate and 
safe foothold is given at the operative angles. 

The ladder and platform should be equipped on both sides with
text_norm: 3.4 intermediate platform fitted self-levelling tread step accommodation ladder designed adequate safe foothold given operative angle ladder platform equipped side

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: stanchions and rigid handrails, but if handropes are used they should be tight
text_raw:
3.5 
stanchions and rigid handrails, but if handropes are used they should be tight 
and properly secured. The vertical space between the handrail or handrope and 
the stringers of the ladder should be securely fenced.
text_norm: 3.5 stanchion rigid handrail handropes used tight properly secured vertical space handrail handrope stringer ladder securely fenced

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: The pilot ladder should be rigged immediately adjacent to the lower
text_raw:
3.6 
The pilot ladder should be rigged immediately adjacent to the lower 
platform of the accommodation ladder and the upper end should extend at least 
2 metres above the lower platform. The horizontal distance between the pilot 
ladder and the lower platform should be between 0.1 metres and 0.2 metres.
text_norm: 3.6 pilot ladder rigged immediately adjacent lower platform accommodation ladder upper end extend least 2 metre lower platform horizontal distance pilot ladder lower platform 0.1 metre 0.2 metre

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: If a trapdoor is fitted in the lower platform to allow access from and to
text_raw:
3.7 
If a trapdoor is fitted in the lower platform to allow access from and to 
the pilot ladder, the aperture should not be less than 750 millimetres x 750 
millimetres. The trapdoor should open upwards and be secured either flat on 
the embarkation platform or against the rails at the aft end or outboard side of 
the platform and should not form part of the handholds. In this case the after 
part of the lower platform should also be fenced as specified in paragraph 3.5, 
and the pilot ladder should extend above the lower platform to the height of the 
handrail and remain in alignment with and against the ship's side.
text_norm: 3.7 trapdoor fitted lower platform allow access pilot ladder aperture le 750 millimetre x 750 millimetre trapdoor open upwards secured either flat embarkation platform rail aft end outboard side platform form part handhold case part lower platform also fenced specified paragraph 3.5 pilot ladder extend lower platform height handrail remain alignment ship side

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 4. MECHANICAL PILOT HOISTS
text_raw:
4. MECHANICAL PILOT HOISTS 

The use of mechanical pilot hoists is prohibited. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [686] 13

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 5. ACCESS TO DECK
text_raw:
5. ACCESS TO DECK 

Means should be provided to ensure safe, convenient and unobstructed passage 
for any person embarking on, or disembarking from, the ship between the head 
of the pilot ladder, or of any accommodation ladder, and the ship's deck; such 
access should be gained directly by a platform securely guarded by handrails. 
Where such passage is by means of:
text_norm: 5 access deck mean provided ensure safe convenient unobstructed passage person embarking disembarking ship head pilot ladder accommodation ladder ship deck access gained directly platform securely guarded handrail passage mean

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 1. a gateway in the rails or bulwark, adequate handholds should be
text_raw:
1. a gateway in the rails or bulwark, adequate handholds should be 
provided at the point of embarking on or disembarking from the 
ship on each side which should be not less than 0.7 metres or more 
than 0.8 metres apart. Each handhold should be rigidly secured to 
the ship's structure at or near its base and also at a higher point, 
should be not less than 32 millimetres in diameter and should 
extend not less than 1.2 metres above the deck to which it is fitted; 
and
text_norm: 1 gateway rail bulwark adequate handhold provided point embarking disembarking ship side le 0.7 metre 0.8 metre apart handhold rigidly secured ship structure near base also higher point le 32 millimetre diameter extend le 1.2 metre deck fitted

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 2. a bulwark ladder, two separate handhold stanchions should be fitted
text_raw:
2. a bulwark ladder, two separate handhold stanchions should be fitted 
at the point of embarking on or disembarking from the ship on each 
side which should be not less than 0.7 metres or more than 0.8 
metres apart. The bulwark ladder should be securely attached to the 
ship to prevent overturning. Each stanchion should be rigidly 
secured to the ship's structure at or near its base and also at a higher 
point, should be not less than 32 millimetres in diameter and should 
extend not less than 1.2 metres above the top of the bulwarks. 
Stanchions or handrails should not be attached to the bulwark 
ladder.
text_norm: 2 bulwark ladder two separate handhold stanchion fitted point embarking disembarking ship side le 0.7 metre 0.8 metre apart bulwark ladder securely attached ship prevent overturning stanchion rigidly secured ship structure near base also higher point le 32 millimetre diameter extend le 1.2 metre top bulwark stanchion handrail attached bulwark ladder

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 6. SAFE APPROACH OF THE PILOT BOAT
text_raw:
6. SAFE APPROACH OF THE PILOT BOAT 

Where rubbing bands or other constructional features might prevent the safe 
approach of a pilot boat, these should be cut back to provide at least 6 metres 
of unobstructed ship's side. 

Specialized offshore ships less than 90 metres or other similar ships less than 
90 metres for which a 6 metre gap in the rubbing bands would not be 
practicable, as determined by the MSO, do not have to comply with this 
requirement. In this case, other appropriate measures should be taken to ensure 
that persons are able to embark and disembark safely.
text_norm: 6 safe approach pilot boat rubbing band constructional feature might prevent safe approach pilot boat cut back provide least 6 metre unobstructed ship side specialized offshore ship le 90 metre similar ship le 90 metre 6 metre gap rubbing band would practicable determined mso comply requirement case appropriate measure taken ensure person able embark disembark safely

heading: 7.1.1 When a pilot ladder winch reel is provided it should be situated at a
text_raw:

position which will ensure persons embarking on, or disembarking from, the

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.3 Handrails and handgrips
text_raw:
7.3 Handrails and handgrips 

Handrails and handgrips should be provided in accordance with section 5 to 
assist the pilot to safely transfer between the pilot ladder and the ship, except as 
noted in paragraph 7.2.2.3 for arrangements with platforms extending 
outboard. The horizontal distance between the handrails and/or the handgrips 
should be not less than 0.7 metres or more than 0.8 metres apart.
text_norm: 7.3 handrail handgrip handrail handgrip provided accordance section 5 assist pilot safely transfer pilot ladder ship except noted paragraph 7.2.2.3 arrangement platform extending outboard horizontal distance handrail handgrip le 0.7 metre 0.8 metre apart

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.5.1 All pilot ladder winch reels should have means of preventing the winch
text_raw:
7.5.1 All pilot ladder winch reels should have means of preventing the winch 
reel from being accidentally operated as a result of mechanical failure or 
human error.
text_norm: 7.5.1 pilot ladder winch reel mean preventing winch reel accidentally operated result mechanical failure human error

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.5.2 Pilot ladder winch reels may be manually operated or, alternatively,
text_raw:
7.5.2 Pilot ladder winch reels may be manually operated or, alternatively, 
powered by either electrical, hydraulic or pneumatic means.
text_norm: 7.5.2 pilot ladder winch reel may manually operated alternatively powered either electrical hydraulic pneumatic mean

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.5.3 Manually operated pilot ladder winch reels should be provided with a
text_raw:
7.5.3 Manually operated pilot ladder winch reels should be provided with a 
brake or other suitable arrangements to control the lowering of the pilot ladder 
and to lock the winch reel in position once the pilot ladder is lowered into 
position.
text_norm: 7.5.3 manually operated pilot ladder winch reel provided brake suitable arrangement control lowering pilot ladder lock winch reel position pilot ladder lowered position

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.5.4 Electrical, hydraulic or pneumatically driven pilot ladder winch reels
text_raw:
7.5.4 Electrical, hydraulic or pneumatically driven pilot ladder winch reels 
should be fitted with safety devices which are capable of cutting off the power 
supply to the winch reel and thus locking the winch reel in position.
text_norm: 7.5.4 electrical hydraulic pneumatically driven pilot ladder winch reel fitted safety device capable cutting power supply winch reel thus locking winch reel position

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.5.5 Powered winch reels should have clearly marked control levers or
text_raw:
7.5.5 Powered winch reels should have clearly marked control levers or 
handles which may be locked in a neutral position.
text_norm: 7.5.5 powered winch reel clearly marked control lever handle may locked neutral position

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: 7.5.6 A mechanical device or locking pin should also be utilized to lock
text_raw:
7.5.6 A mechanical device or locking pin should also be utilized to lock 
powered winch reels. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 December, 2020. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport.

title: Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 351 of 2020)), hereby
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Rules implement Chapter V of the International Convention for the 
Safety of Life at Sea (SOLAS), 1974, and subsequent Protocols and 
amendments, up to and including those adopted by the 90th Session of the 
Maritime Safety Committee of the IMO in May 2012, in particular Regulation 
23 relating to equipment and arrangements for pilot transfer which were 
installed on or after 1 January 1994. 

The Rules require ships engaged on voyages in the course of which pilots are 
likely to be employed to provide pilot transfer arrangements and to ensure that 
pilot ladders and their arrangements, use and maintenance conform to IMO 
standards. 

The Rules apply to seagoing Irish registered ships and to ships registered in 
another state while they are in a port in the State. They do not apply to fishing 
vessels. 

The Rules revoke the Merchant Shipping (Pilot Ladders & Hoists) Rules, 1993 
(S.I. No. 55 of 1993). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 18 [686]
